name: Tartaglia
desc: The Eleventh of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, known as Childe. His real name is Ajax.

value.name: Tartaglia
value.desc: No. 11 of The Harbingers, also known as "Childe." His name is highly feared on the battlefield.

value.name: Childe
value.desc:
"Childe" Tartaglia, Eleventh of the Fatui Harbingers.
He draws power from the ominous Delusion he possesses and fights using martial arts that he learned in a land of darkness.

He is a pure warrior with an insatiable lust for battle.
Each bloody conflict, each life-and-death struggle is a delightful trial to him.
People say that the young Childe is famed throughout the land for his battle prowess.
But he has never taken big talk of this kind to heart.

After all...
"You shall ever be the eye of the storm,
"And the clashing of steel shall ever accompany you.
"The pitch-black memory of stepping into uttermost darkness,
"Shall, at last, become the strength by which you will overturn this world."

value.name: Tartaglia
value.desc:
"Childe" Tartaglia

Should this table be considered a battlefield, then may the strongest claim the win.

customize.text: Relationships

Snezhnaya
Ajax grew up in Morepesok, Snezhnaya.

customize.name: Skirk
customize.desc: A mysterious swordswoman from the Abyss and Tartaglia's master.

customize.text: When Ajax was 14, he fell to the Abyss and met with a swordswoman, Skirk. She taught him to fight.

customize.name: Pulcinella
customize.desc: The Fifth of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, known as The Rooster. He is a mayor of Snezhnaya.

customize.text: Pulcinella noticed Ajax's fighting skills and recruited him to the Fatui, forcing him to start from the bottom and dedicate himself to serving the Tsaritsa. Pulcinella now takes care of Tartaglia's family.

customize.name: Fatui
customize.desc: A Snezhnayan organization that is loyal to the Tsaritsa and has spread out all over the continent. Its Harbingers are on the hunt for the Gnoses.

customize.text: save Liyue.

customize.name: All-Devouring Narwhal
customize.desc:
A mysterious and gargantuan creature from another world.

Poets often liken the starry sky to the ocean. They've seen or dreamt of countless bioluminescent plankton floating on a moonless sea, resembling a galaxy, or the moonlight ripped apart by waves on the sea's surface, like shimmering stars. In the most fantastical stories or outrageous lies, the stars found in the depths of the cosmos might be teeming with life, much like Teyvat, and the universe itself is akin to an ocean. Realistically speaking, however, if a profound universe full of life exists, why hasn't any of that life made contact with Teyvat?

Maybe the universe has been constantly trying to infiltrate Teyvat, or maybe a higher power created borders to protect this world.

customize.text: A pet of Skirk's master,

customize.name: Surtalogi
customize.desc: One of the Five Sinners of Khaenri'ah, also known as "The Foul."

customize.text:
, which consumes the Primordial Sea. When Tartaglia fell into the Abyss, he awoke the narwhal. The Harbinger tried to stop it when the All-Devouring Narwhal became a cause of the Fontaine prophecy.
Oratrice Mecanique d'Analyse Cardinale
The device that renders verdicts in Fontaine's court cases, which accused Tartaglia of involvement in a series of disappearances that began 20 years ago, when Tartaglia was just a child.

customize.name: Xinyan
customize.desc: Liyue's sole rock 'n' roll musician. She rebels against ossified prejudices using her music and passionate singing.

customize.text: Together with Xinyan and the Traveler, Tartaglia explored the Mystic Onmyou Chamber.

customize.name: Yoimiya
customize.desc: Owner of Naganohara Fireworks. Known as "Queen of the Summer Festival," she excels in her craft of creating fireworks that symbolize people's hopes and dreams.

customize.text: Tartaglia helped Yoimiya and the Inazuman children to find Great Mujina Youkai.
Related Items

customize.name: Childe's Vision
customize.desc: It appears as if Childe lost control of the Elemental Power within it before. The Vision has lost its glow now that its owner has left it behind.

customize.name: Shard of a Foul Legacy
customize.desc:
The shard of a weapon that you obtained from defeating Childe, who had unleashed the might of his Delusion.
It is stained with a profound color that is not of this world, no doubt due to the land of endless darkness that the young boy saw with his own two eyes.
Perhaps it has nothing to do with the power of a Delusion, but as they say, the weapon reflects its user...

customize.name: Tusk of Monoceros Caeli
customize.desc:
The horn of a whale that you obtained from defeating Childe, who had unleashed the might of his Delusion.
It is said that the shape of one's constellation determines one's character. The image of a whale cruising across the celestial heights represents a solipsism that seeks to crush and devour all in its path.
Embracing this aspect of himself, Childe gleefully summoned one such beast before throwing himself into battle against you.

customize.name: Shadow of the Warrior
customize.desc:
A fragment of power that you obtained from defeating Childe, who had unleashed the might of his Delusion.
It is the product of a will to fight that has been honed over countless slaughters.
If humans do indeed have destinies, then his must surely have been twisted by such deeds. Why else, then, would he always be at the heart of every conflict?

customize.name: Ballad of the Fjords
customize.desc: A polearm used by those seeking to catch fish in the tundra. It lets none escape.

customize.text: Ajax

Ajax was born in Snezhnaya, in the village of Morepesok. He got his name from the hero of legends who discovered the country of gold and white stone in the depths of the frozen sea. There are many stories about him: he sailed on a ship into the belly of a great whale, fought with a dragon upon the frozen plains for seven days, and lost his beloved Snegurochka due to the wicked tricks of the changelings. One day, he fell into a hitherto undiscovered kingdom, the capital of which sank underground due to some ancient disaster. The solemn and silent king still sat upon his massive, chiseled white throne, the scepter in his hands not yet eaten away by insects, and the silver-white trees in the courtyard were like the arms of a mother or a lover, holding the virtuous and wise priest in their embrace. Violent monsters began to awaken from their slumber, and one of these monsters was a dragon whose treasure was an infinite hoard of gold. But the boy was kind and brave and knew that gold was the true cause of calamity and chaos, so he only took a small amount, enough for his own needs and to cure his sick friends.

When Ajax was 14, he grew tired of the monotony of his family life and ran away from home, taking only a short blade and a piece of bread with him. Lost in a snowy forest and running from bears and wolves, Ajax fell into a bottomless crack in the ground. There he saw the endless world of the Abyss, and a swordswoman named Skirk, disciple of one of the Khaenri'ahn Sinners, Surtalogi, noticed the boy. During his three months in the Abyss, Ajax learned to move freely through the dark realm and to incite conflicts using his predisposition to chaos. Immediately after the fall, the boy had a dream: he was deep underwater, and around him was the endless seabed. And then a whale appeared before him, so huge that it took his breath away. In the Abyss, the boy met the All-Devouring Narwhal — Surtalogi's pet, who several years later became the reason for the fulfillment of Fontaine's prophecy. When Ajax asked his master why she took him on, she answered that he had awakened "something," that it had left its marks on him, and that combat training would be useful to him in the future. In addition, in the Abyss, Ajax received the Foul Legacy — a special, extremely dangerous power that put his body under tremendous strain.

When the young man was finally found by his mother and sister, only three days had passed in the real world. From that moment, Ajax changed: from a cowardly and indecisive boy, he turned into a self-confident warrior who acted as if the world revolved around him. He became a nexus of strife, for no matter where he went, fights and squabbles would follow — and he reveled in it. After one nearly fatal fight, Ajax's father was forced to send his son to the Fatui. The father hoped that the strict military discipline inherent in the Fatui would harden his son's character, but instead, he was forced to watch as the young man easily dealt with a squad of well-armed warriors. This incident attracted the attention of Pulcinella, the mayor of Snezhnaya and number five of the Fatui Harbingers. He was surprised by Ajax's fighting skills and extremely intrigued by his nature, attracting trouble around himself and enjoying it. Pulcinella accepted Ajax into the Fatui and, under the pretext of punishment, forced him to start from the very bottom and dedicate himself to serving the Tsaritsa. Ajax's uncontrollable thirst for battle was fully satisfied by his service to the Fatui, and his growing ego was sated by victories over powerful opponents. Eventually, Ajax became number eleven of the Fatui Harbingers and received the title of
Thus, he became one of the most powerful men in Snezhnaya and the youngest Fatui Harbinger.

customize.text: Tartaglia

On the day Tartaglia became a Harbinger, the leader of the Harbingers himself, Pierro, attached the Delusion to the boy's belt. It was his reward for defeating terrible monsters and a memento of countless battles. The Delusion was only a sign of honor for Childe, and all his attention was focused on the Tsaritsa, who on her lofty throne alone stirred the young man's heart with respect and admiration, not merely because she opened the way for him to find an abundance of looming battles, but also because of the way she looked upon him. Her gaze was cold but pure, arrogant yet sharp. She was not only the sacrosanct Cryo Archon but also a true warrior. Thus did Childe, having received his Delusion, swear an oath of fealty to the one and only Tsaritsa of Snezhnaya. Despite his young age, Childe is one of the most dangerous Fatui Harbingers, whose easy-going appearance hides a deadly slaughterer who is a master of all types of weapons and martial arts. The only thing that can be stronger than his skills is his love of battle and conflict. Childe enjoys using risky tactics and craves meeting strong opponents. His arrogance is backed by his rich combat experience and perfect skills. However, Tartaglia is not on friendly terms with the other Harbingers and does not agree with the deceitful and treacherous methods of Fatui's work. The Harbingers themselves believe that Childe's quarrelsome personality tends to invite unwanted trouble, and they constantly try to get him sent on missions to places as far from Snezhnaya as possible so that they can avoid the fallout, where Tartaglia always finds himself in the center of chaos and conflict. Despite his character and unceremonious manner, Childe is considered a responsible and trustworthy person who always keeps his promises.

One of the tasks entrusted to Childe was to obtain the Geo Gnosis. When Tartaglia arrived in Liyue, during the Rite of Descent, when the Geo Archon, Morax, had been descending upon the people of the nation, Rex Lapis was killed. When the Milleliths became suspicious of the Traveler and Paimon present at the ceremony, Tartaglia helped them, knowing that they were innocent. They joined forces and went to find out the truth about the Archon's death and contacted the Wangsheng Funeral Parlor consultant, Zhongli. Although Tartaglia saved the Traveler and told them about his work in the Fatui, he did not tell the whole truth about his mission. The Harbinger gave the Traveler a fake Sigil of Permission, which people used to use to have audiences with the Adepti. After Childe's agents monitoring the Traveler and Zhongli discovered that the Geo Archon's
was hidden by the ruling organization, the Qixing, in the Golden House, Tartaglia infiltrated the chamber to steal the Gnosis.

When the Gnosis was not found on the Exuvia, Childe suspected that the Traveler might have obtained the Gnosis and that Rex Lapis was actually alive and decided to lure him out. The Fatui produced thousands of Sigils of Permission so that they could be used to awaken one of the deities defeated in the Archon War, Osial. Childe hoped that if Liyue was in such danger, Morax would not be able to stand aside and would be forced to come to the aid of the people. Despite the threat, the Qixing, the Millelith, and the Adepti were able to stop Osial on their own. When Tartaglia arrived at the Northland Bank after Liyue's battle with Osial, it turned out that he was not the only Harbinger sent on this mission. Behind his back, the number eight of the Fatui Harbingers, Signora, made a deal on behalf of the Tsaritsa with Zhongli, who was actually the Geo Archon. In accordance with this "contract to end all contracts," Rex Lapis gave his Gnosis to Snezhnaya.
Although the Harbinger deceived the Traveler and fought them in the Golden House when he wanted to steal the Gnosis, Tartaglia considers them as his friend, with whom he is always ready to fight and improve his skills.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.text: Inazuma

One day, a domain entrance appeared in the Araumi area of Inazuma, and monsters began pouring out of it. The Tenryou Commission began the investigation, but many soldiers were injured, and no one dared to enter the domain. When no one was near the entrance, Tartaglia entered, easily dealing with all the monsters. Later, the Traveler, Paimon, and the rock singer from Liyue, Xinyan, arrived there and agreed to help the Commission. They took a
named Shiki Taishou with them. He remembered almost nothing about his life, but he only knew that he was the Overseer of this domain, the Mystic Onmyou Chamber. To avoid conflict between the Liyue resident and the Harbinger, who had endangered the country, Paimon presented Childe as an Adventurer from Mondstadt. After Tartaglia and the others dealt with the monsters that appeared, Shiki Taishou touched the mechanism that was supposed to open the door, but instead, it rearranged the rooms of the Mystic Chamber. The Harbinger was locked inside the domain and was forced to fight for several days. Despite this, Childe enjoyed fighting and wanted to participate in battles in all the rooms.

Tartaglia's main goal in life was self-improvement. He fought in the crevices between the roots of giant trees, faced limitless danger, and entered into deadly duels. All this allowed him to become stronger. The Harbinger believed that he was born to fight, and as long as he breathed, his calling would never end. After Xinyan, Tartaglia, Traveler, and Paimon helped Shiki Taishou regain all of his memories and gain full control of the Mystic Onmyou Chamber, the Harbinger revealed his purpose for coming to Inazuma. When the sixth of the Fatui Harbingers, Scaramouche, took possession of the Electro Gnosis, the Fatui lost contact with him. Believing that the sudden appearance of a domain filled with monsters might be related to the missing Harbinger, Childe went to investigate but was unable to find Scaramoiche. Wanting to enjoy the battles, Tartaglia decided to linger in the Mystic Onmyou Chamber.

The next time the Harbinger visited Inazuma on business, he decided to buy his siblings gifts. Remembering that Teucer was curious about what a real Inazuma onikabuto looked like, Tartaglia went "hunting." While searching for bugs in Chinju Forest, he saw a child running around, almost getting caught by a monster. The Harbinger saved the boy and got rid of the monsters, and on the way back, he met the fireworks master, Nagonahara Yoimiya. The girl helped the children track down a powerful demon, Great Mujina Youkai, and the boy Childe saved, was one of those children. According to legend, the demon scared and bullied children who went out at night. Although Yoimiya and Tartaglia knew that the Great Mujina Yokai was an invention of adults to prevent children from running away alone, Tartaglia agreed to cover for the children and protect them from danger. Yoimiya guessed Childe's position because she heard about what happened in Liyue, but she saw how much the Harbinger cared about the children and sincerely wanted to help them, so she allowed him to stay. When Tartaglia was about to leave Inazuma, the girl helped him choose souvenirs for his siblings and also offered to take the fireworks she had recently designed.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Shiki Koshou
customize.desc:
A gift from Shiki Taishou: a replica armed with spiritual power.

Though Shiki Koshou is incapable of charm magic, it is in contact with Shiki Taishou at all times and can share all that it has seen and heard with him, so it's almost like you've still got Shiki Taishou with you on your journey.

customize.text: Fontaine

A few years after his mission in Liyue, Childe traveled to Fontaine, where he ran errands for the Northland Bank and, out of boredom, sparred with the Champion Duelists, the country's finest fighters. While collecting debts from the Bank, the Harbinger discovered that his Hydro powers refused to obey him when he needed them. Thinking that the problem might lie in the Hydro Vision, Tartaglia gave it to the Traveler, whom he had met shortly before the battle, for safekeeping. In addition to his Hydro powers, Childe had the feeling that there was some restless force stirring within him that could affect his control of the elements. Tartaglia recalled his fall into the Abyss as a youth and that his power was related to that incident, but he was never able to find his mentor, Skirk, to get answers.

Some time after meeting the Traveler, Childe was taken into custody in connection with a series of disappearances in Fontaine. The first disappearances began twenty years ago, when Tartaglia was just a child. During this time, young girls of about the same age were being kidnapped in Fontaine, and no one could find either the body or the culprit. In order to help their friend and solve the case, the Traveler and Paimon collected evidence pointing to a native of Snezhnaya and an Adventurer, Vacher. Over twenty years ago, he came to Fontaine, where he met another adventurer, Vigneire, and fell in love with her. During one of her underwater expeditions, Vigneire came into contact with the waters of the Primordial Sea, which dissolved her in front of Vacher, since all Fontainians were once Oceanids, and the waters of the Primordial Sea returned them to their original form. Vacher was so distraught by her death that he began kidnapping Fontainian girls of Vigneire's age in an attempt to resurrect her. The Traveler and Paimon discovered Vacher's secret laboratory and the missing girls' belongings, and it seemed that the case of the serial disappearances of girls was solved, but the Oratrice Mecanique d'Analyse Cardinale, a special device created by the Hydro Archon Focalors, found not only Vacher guilty but Childe as well. Since the Oratrice's verdicts were decisive, the Gardes were to escort him to the Fortress of Meropide. Using the Delusion, Tartaglia attacked the Gardes, but the Chief Justice, Neuvillette, defeated him, promising to find out the whole truth.

A few days after Childe was sent to the Fortress of Meropide on charges, he disappeared. The Fatui sent their agents to find out about the disappearance of the Harbinger, but none of them returned. Another Fatui Harbinger, Arlecchino, demanded that the Chief Justice grant her access to the prison, but he refused, offering a compromise. Under this compromise, the Traveler and Paimon went to the Fortress to secretly investigate Childe's disappearance. In the prison, the Traveler, still holding Childe's Vision, saw dreams through it in which the Harbinger was called by someone and then ended up in the Primordial Sea, where a huge whale was above him. Although the Traveler and Paimon found out the circumstances of their friend's disappearance, they were never able to find him. It turned out that Childe had worked hard in the Fortress, which earned him the respect of the other prisoners, and they helped him escape into a drainpipe, from which he ended up in the Primordial Sea. On the day the Traveler and Paimon were supposed to leave the Fortress, the level of the Primordial Sea suddenly rose, starting to dissolve people.

In order to determine whether Fontaine's prophecy had come true, the Chief Justice, the Traveler, Paimon, and other Fontainians decided to hold a trial against the Hydro Archon Furina. During the trial, a rift suddenly opened in the opera Epiclese, through which a narwhal and Tartaglia, who was fighting with it, entered. Although all Fontainians saw the main threat in the flood of the Primordial Sea, it turned out to be the All-Devouring Narwhal, which the Traveler saw through Childe's Vision. The monster did not belong to Teyvat and had traversed the stars, weeping all the while. It had been greedily consuming the energy from the planet's Primordial Sea, using it to grow. It was its actions that led to the rise of the sea level. Since the Fontainians had the Primordial Sea in their blood, they attracted the narwhal to themselves, and, leaving the waters of the Primordial Sea, it decided to head straight to the opera house, where so many Fontainians had gathered.

The narwhal absorbed too much of the Primordial Sea's energy and, at that point, had become practically integrated with the Sea itself. Even if the entirety of Teyvat were to be destroyed, it could still survive and swim off toward some other world. Tartaglia, who fought the monster for a long time, was able to gain time, and without him, the narwhal would have reached land much earlier. Thanks to the intervention of Neuvillette and Tartaglia, the Harbinger and the narwhal disappeared back into the rift, and those gathered in court began to come up with a new plan to fight the prophecy. When the Chief Justice got the authority to defeat the All-Devouring Narwhal and separate it from the power of the Primordial Sea, he and the Traveler entered the Primordial Sea, where they met Tartaglia's mentor, Skirk, the narwhal, and the Harbinger himself. Due to the prolonged battle with the All-Devouring Narwhal, Childe was left powerless and was later sent to Snezhnaya for treatment. Although the Harbinger was not guilty of the serial disappearances, the Oratrice's verdict was not accidental, and it was this that allowed them to buy time and defeat the All-Devouring Narwhal, saving the Fontainians from dissolution.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.text: Family

According to the Snezhnaya tradition, family comes first, and Tartaglia is no exception. He constantly writes letters home to his brothers, Teucer and Anthon, and his sister, Tonia, telling them stories of his travels to other countries. Along with the letters, he sends medicine, souvenirs, and gifts. Although the adult members of Tartaglia's family know of his service to the Tsaritsa, the Harbinger does not want his younger siblings to know of Snezhnaya's dark side. To them, Childe is the best expatriate toy seller. When the Harbinger was on assignment in Liyue, he said that he was temporarily assigned to the Liyue Branch of the Institute for Toy Research. One day, Tartaglia's younger brother, Teucer, missing his brother, saw a lone ship and secretly went to Liyue. Not knowing where to go, the boy went straight until he met a Ruin Guard without an energy block. Thinking that the robot was Mr. Cyclops, one of the toys his brother was selling, Teucer was excited and wanted to play with it, but he was found and stopped by Traveler and Paimon, who were tracking the out-of-control Ruin Guards. Together, they went to look for Childe at the Northland Bank.

After learning of his brother's arrival in Liyue, Childe asked Traveler and Paimon to spend time with Teucer while he was doing his Harbinger work. Even after buying him a Mr. Cyclops kite, a special meal, and a tour of Liyue Harbor, Teucer missed his brother and wanted to spend time with him. When the Traveler and Paimon took the child to Childe, who was collecting debts from the Treasure Hoarders, the Harbinger had to pretend to sell toys. And when Tartaglia had to give a welcoming speech to the Fatui recruits, he told his brother that they were new toy salesmen. When Teucer saw his brother fighting the recruits, he wanted to learn how to fight as well, so he could protect his sister Tonia, and Childe promised to teach him when he returned to Snezhnaya. Before sending Teucer home, Childe decided to fulfill his dream and take him to the Liyue Institute for Toy Research, which was actually a research center for another Harbinger, Il Dottore. A few days before the boy arrived from Snezhnaya, the Ruin Guards in the center went out of control and began attacking people nearby, but Tartaglia was ready to protect his brother from any danger. When they reached the end of the research center, the Harbinger saw many Ruin Guards that had received energy. To prevent Teucer from seeing his brother's battle with Mr. Cyclops, Childe suggested playing hide-and-seek and counting to 60. As time was running out, Tartaglia used the Foul Legacy form to defeat all the Guards. Although he had used an extremely dangerous Foul Legacy transformation during his last encounter with the Traveler in the Golden House and was still recovering from his injuries, he could not allow his brother's dream to be destroyed.

<color=#ffffffd9>"Anyway, childhood dreams are all too easily shattered. Even if you just leave them be, they will fall to pieces all by themselves.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>So, someone has to protect them, right?</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>If you make a promise, you keep it, if you make a mistake, you apologize...</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>And if you give someone a dream, you defend it to the end...</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>That is what family is all about, isn't it?"</color>

When the Traveler found the wounded Harbinger, he gave Teucer a custom-made Mr. Cyclops figurine and asked them to say goodbye to him so that his brother would not have to see his weakened state.
In addition to his family, Tartaglia also cares for other children. Although Childe considers another Fatui Harbinger, The Knave, dangerous, he has befriended the children of the House of the Hearth, the orphanage under her leadership. If Arlecchino were to betray her children, Tartaglia would stand up for them and take revenge on her.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Teucer
customize.desc: Tartaglia's younger brother.

customize.name: Il Dottore
customize.desc: The Second of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, codenamed The Doctor. Had multiple "segments" of himself, nearly all of which he destroyed in a deal with the Dendro Archon.

customize.name: Ruin Guard
customize.desc:
An ancient humanoid war machine.
Legend has it that these machines were combat automatons created by a long-destroyed nation. They now wander ruins and ancient detritus, attacking offending travelers. Research indicates that the Ruin Guards and the ruins they operate in do not originate from the same source, suggesting that there may be a difference of as much as several thousand years between them on the timeline. So why then do the Ruin Guards continue staying among these ruins, using their "explosive firepower" to protect the crumbling walls and broken tiles?

customize.name: Mr. Cyclops Action Figure
customize.desc: A "Mr. Cyclops" toy that Childe had specially-made for Teucer. It even has the lad's name on it.

customize.name: Skirk
customize.desc: A mysterious swordswoman from the Abyss and Tartaglia's master.

customize.name: Skirk
customize.desc: A visitor who once appeared in an Abyssal rift and the Primordial Sea, this solitary warrior mentored Tartaglia in the martial arts.

customize.text: Character Story

<color=#ffd780>Character Details</color>
Her existence is like an unproven rumor...
Sometimes, past the stroke of midnight, a taverngoer will swear he had glimpsed her, waving hands painting a story of a person that nobody could be sure ever was.
For a very long time, Skirk has journeyed through Teyvat like a shadow, avoiding anything more than brief contact with others, only gathering intel when absolutely necessary.
It wasn't until very recently that there came to be one who could claim to know her...
"Oh, my master? Haha, she's the type to keep to herself."
"And, let's see... She's an alright cook. Could've been the creatures in that space tasting a little off in general, of course."
"We initially agreed to swing by my place after leaving. I wanted to let her try my family's homemade sausages this year. It's a real shame she couldn't make it..."
"But enough of that. After all, what matters most about my master is her strength... and the sheer arrogance she has to go with it!"
"Hmm? Oh, no, I know what I said. I'm not being ironic, and I mean no insult."
"As I, Tartaglia, grow stronger every day, I get the chance to know my master's strength anew with each and every sunrise."
"When we first started my training, she only needed one hand to beat me. That was undoubtedly her arrogance shining through. But when facing a weak opponent, I believe that arrogance is an aesthetic unto itself."
"To crush them outright would be unbecoming, yet to feign humility, only to turn the tables later on? That, dear comrade, would be far too deliberate."
In the present day, this "review" of Skirk reached her ears while she was drinking in a tavern. She furrowed her brow.
"As I've said before, I still communicate normally with those who possess some measure of skill. And the food in the Abyssal rift only tasted off to him because he's an ordinary human."
"And about training — I don't really care how many hands I use, but I do care how many he'll have left when I'm done teaching."
"He still needs to live in Teyvat, so he can't just make new limbs for himself with Abyssal energy like I can."
"Arrogance and carelessness are both dangerous things. It's good that he wants to improve, rather than to show off."
"Otherwise, I'd start worrying about finding his corpse in some strange nook or cranny."
Voice-Over

<color=#ffd780>About Tartaglia</color>
He's improved — next time we spar, I might even use both hands. Ajax has a lot of talent and he is fearless in battle, which gives him the potential to develop great strength. But I've seen many other bright sparks like him fizzle out before ever reaching their prime. If he truly wants to become the person he dreams of being, he still has a long road ahead.
Dialogues

<color=#ffd780>About their meeting</color>
His situation is different than yours. Before you ever crossed paths with me, you'd already encountered many formidable people, studied their techniques, and developed your own skillset.
So, during your training, all I had to do was build upon that foundation. But, Ajax was so young when he came to me — a complete blank canvas.
Children can't help but imitate their role models. In the long run, that would only hinder his growth.
Once Ajax has enough strength in his own right, I will allow us to meet again. Until then, let that motivate him to reach his full potential.

customize.name: Scaramouche
customize.desc: The former sixth of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, created by Raiden Ei.

customize.name: Wanderer
customize.desc: A wayfaring figure whose identity is a mystery. He dresses like a mountain ascetic, but he certainly does not act the part.

customize.text: Voice-Over

<color=#ffd780>About Childe</color>
He's simple of mind and not that strong of body. Naming him to the lowest-ranked seat lowered the Harbingers' collective prestige. Thankfully, I'm no longer part of that group.
<color=#ffd780>About The Rooster</color>
Only someone as dense as Childe would think The Rooster is looking after him and his family out of the goodness of his heart. Although the mayor has indeed done a number of things for their benefit, anyone with a brain would be able to tell that the underlying meaning is "your entire family is in my hands."
Dialogues

<color=#ffd780>About the Harbingers</color>
Signora and Childe? Huh... I didn't know you and my two least reliable colleagues were acquainted.

customize.name: Arlecchino
customize.desc: "The Knave," Fourth of the Fatui Harbingers. A poised, ruthless diplomat. To the children in the House of the Hearth, she is their feared yet dependable "Father."

customize.text: Voice-Over

<color=#ffd780>About Childe</color>
Objectively speaking, his personality is ill-suited to that of a Harbinger. He often tries to think the best of others... and finds himself used by them as a result. Of course, he is very talented. With time, I'm sure he'll come into his own. I see no need to judge him too early.
Dialogues

<color=#ffd780>About Childe</color>
I wonder how he's doing nowadays. You must have heard, right? He's suddenly gone missing. I'm really worried about his safety, you know. Here's to hoping that he's an excellent swimmer.
Oh, so you're also familiar with his aptitude for fighting, Miss Furina? Ah, right, I almost forgot. Childe was subdued by Iudex Neuvillette right in front of you.
Against ordinary people, my colleague would never be on the back foot, but alas, he just never imagined he'd run into such a person... Hmm... I must express my admiration for Monsieur Neuvillette.
<color=#ffd780>About Childe's disappearance</color>
It appears the ever-busy Iudex Neuvillette doesn't wish to waste time with diplomatic pleasantries and hopes that we can get straight to the point of our talk.
Yes, as you surmised, understanding Childe's situation is indeed one of the goals of this trip.
As we are both diplomats from Snezhnaya as well as Fatui Harbingers, Childe and I have always been colleagues...
Were anything to happen in Fontaine, each of us would serve as the other's attorney to resolve the issue.
So now, in my capacity as his attorney, I request that Childe be turned over to Snezhnaya. We have a responsibility to cooperate with Fontaine and resolve what has happened to him together.
An outright refusal... Very well. I respect all the rules of Fontaine's courts, just as I respect you as Chief Justice.
You don't need to transfer Childe to us. I only request to enter the Fortress of Meropide to see Childe and confirm his condition.
Dialogues

<color=#ffd780>About Childe</color>
The Harbingers? They're way above my pay grade. I'm lucky if I hear the odd rumor.
For what it's worth, I can pass on what others have told me. But I advise you to take it with a pinch of salt.
Have you heard of Childe? Word has it that this Harbinger travels often and will bring gifts to his family when he comes back.
Someone I know told me that he heard that the younger brothers and sisters of Master Childe all really like him.
*sigh* But I don't want to be transferred to work for him, given that I might have to hustle everywhere again.

customize.name: Furina
customize.desc: The absolute focus of the stage of judgment, until the final applause sounds.

customize.text: Dialogues

<color=#ffd780>About Childe's innocence</color>
If you thought Childe had nothing to do with the serial disappearances case, it is only because you have been blinded by the superficial appearance of innocence...
Everything he's done, not to mention the danger he poses, are beyond ordinary comprehension and completely unforgivable!
All shall be revealed in time! You will come to understand my noble intentions, as well as the absolute correctness of the Oratrice's verdict. Hahahaha...

customize.name: Neuvillette
customize.desc: The Chief Justice of Fontaine, known as the Iudex, is renowned for his unassailable impartiality.

customize.text: Dialogues

<color=#ffd780>About Childe's innocence</color>
My apologies. My investigation has still not reached its conclusion.
However, I still believe the judgment of the Oratrice was not rendered arbitrarily.
For many years, I have been quite aware that the Oratrice does not simply mechanically repeat the verdict that I give on each case.
As a divinely created mechanism, the people's unified faith in the concept of justice is integrated into it.
Not only can it produce the incredible power of Indemnitium, but it likely also possesses other traits... such as self-awareness.
Which is all to say I've been prepared for a situation like this for a long time.
In any case, I am inclined to believe that the Oratrice does have a methodology all its own... We just do not have enough information.
Based on Furina's reaction, I doubt even she had any idea what was going on. She managed to bluff her way through it, though, with time-tested twin tricks of bravado and drama.
While we do intend to get to the bottom of this, for now, we regret to say that the Fatui Harbinger will just have to bide his time in the Fortress of Meropide.
If we did incorrectly convict him of crimes he did not commit, we will most certainly compensate him to the fullest extent allowed by the law.
<color=#ffd780>About Childe's disappearance</color>
In reality, this problem is even more thorny than it appears. According to reports from the Fortress of Meropide, Childe recently disappeared under mysterious circumstances.
The details are still unclear. We cannot rule out an escape, but there have also been no reports of him outside of the Fortress of Meropide.
Special guards oversee the Fortress, and its internal systems are extensive. Combined with the special characteristics of the surrounding terrain, an escape should not be possible. I suspect that there's something else behind Childe's disappearance.
I was only willing to share this information with you because you are friends of Childe, and it is my duty to see justice done.
I would like you to go to the Fortress of Meropide and investigate Childe's disappearance.
This was my proposal during our meeting with The Knave. Rather than allowing her to intervene, I offered to send someone to find out about Childe's situation and report back to her in detail.
The Knave did not seem satisfied by my proposal, but she still agreed to go along with it for the time being. Her words were, "We will talk more once we have that report."
<color=#ffd780>About Childe's innocence</color>
About the initial verdict that was passed on Childe...
I have investigated his case along many avenues, and I have learned that he once fell into an unknown chasm when he was young. There, by chance, he awakened the All-Devouring Narwhal.
But, whether it be by sentiment or reason, that should not have been enough to consider him the root cause of the disaster. At most, he would have had tangential liability.
As for the judgment passed by the Oratrice during the trial...
Whether it was due to that liability by association, or Focalors deliberately using him to buy time for us on the assumption that he would be able to hold the creature off... I cannot say.
Guess Focalors had Fontainians in mind the whole time. In the end, it was thanks to her that they finally became real humans...
Dialogues

<color=#ffd780>About the prophecy</color>
<color=#37ffff>Mikhail</color> : Hey, did you hear? That prophecy that had everyone in Fontaine worried came true!
<color=#37ffff>Lyudmila</color> : Wait, so does that mean something terrible happened?
<color=#37ffff>Mikhail</color> : Well, for Fontainians, there's good news and there's bad news.
<color=#37ffff>Mikhail</color> : The good news is that nobody dissolved in the water. The bad news is that there was still a huge flood.
<color=#37ffff>Lyudmila</color> : I see... So, did Lady Arlecchino...
<color=#37ffff>Mikhail</color> : Nothing to worry about! The Knave came out on top, didn't take a single loss!
<color=#37ffff>Mikhail</color> : In fact, apparently she even obtained the Hydro Archon's Gnosis for the Tsaritsa because she helped the Court of Fontaine!
<color=#37ffff>Lyudmila</color> : For real? But I heard that Master Childe was badly hurt during the flood...
<color=#37ffff>Mikhail</color> : Master Childe? There's even less of a need to worry about him.
<color=#37ffff>Mikhail</color> : He's famous for his combat abilities. I'm sure he'll be up and about soon!

customize.name: Yelan
customize.desc: A mysterious person who claims to work for the Ministry of Civil Affairs, but is a "non-entity" on the Ministry of Civil Affairs' list.

customize.text: Voice-Over

<color=#ffd780>About Tartaglia</color>
The Fatui harbinger? He helped me out once — unwittingly. I was planning a deep-reaching investigation into the former owner of the Yanshang Teahouse, but our harbinger friend got to him first. He showed up demanding payment of his debt, and also exposed his accounting fraud, which got him thrown in jail. That made it very easy for me to take over Yanshang Teahouse myself, and it's proven to be a very useful base.

customize.name: Zhongli
customize.desc: A mysterious expert contracted by the Wangsheng Funeral Parlor. Extremely knowledgeable in all things.

customize.text: Voice-Over

<color=#ffd780>About Tartaglia: Composed</color>
That rascal from Snezhnaya has yet to depart from Liyue? Heh, no matter. Just let me know if he gives you any trouble. I shall deal with the matter swiftly.
<color=#ffd780>About Tartaglia: Drinks</color>
It's said that Childe and his reputation have yet again stirred up waves among the inner ranks of the Fatui. Knowing his type, he will be sure to swiftly depose anyone who dares to challenge his actions. Hmm... Come to think of it, there will be a lot of interesting news to be heard the next time we gather for drinks. Care to join me when the time comes, Traveler?
